subject: Relationships
title: Cross-Generational Friendships
description: A quick win: understand Cross-Generational Friendships.

hook.text: A 70-year-old and a 25-year-old become best friends at a community garden. Society finds this unusual. Why?

buildup.text: Age-segregated social structures â€” schools, workplaces, retirement homes â€” separate generations artificially.

discovery.text: Cross-generational friendships reduce ageism, increase wisdom transfer, and improve mental health for both parties.

twist.text: Younger friends keep older people cognitively sharp. Older friends give younger people perspective and calm.

climax.text: The best friendships don't check IDs. Shared values and curiosity cross every generational boundary.

punchline.text: The best friendships don't ask your age. They ask your story.

quiz.question: What benefits do cross-generational friendships provide?
options: Reduce ageism and improve mental health for both
